thread.title: Arsene Wenger set to stay at Arsenal for two more years despite growing unrest among supporters
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger set to stay at Arsenal for two more years despite growing unrest among supporters

author: dwright
title: Arsene Wenger set to stay at Arsenal for two more years despite growing unrest among supporters
text:
ready to sign Arsene Wenger set to stay at Arsenal for two more years despite growing unrest among supporters 
Wenger has told the Gunners board he is keen to extend his contract amid fan protests and poor form on the pitch By Duncan Wright 30th March 2017, 8:22 am Updated: 30th March 2017, 9:03 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENE WENGER is ready to stay on as Arsenal manager for another two years – providing he gets the backing of the club’s board. 
The Gunners boss has been under mounting pressure to leave the club when his existing deal runs out at the end of this season. Getty Images 3 Arsene Wenger is set to stay as Arsenal boss for another two years 
Poor form on the pitch has led to growing protests among supporters for the Frenchman to step aside and let someone new take control. 
Keep up to date with all the latest news, gossip, rumours and done deals in SunSport’s live transfer blog 
But the 67-year-old appears to have shrugged off the increasingly bitter criticism from the club’s own fans by deciding he still believes he can bring success to the Emirates. PA:Press Association 3 Wenger is set to stay despiote growing calls for him to leave the club from fans 
Wenger is understood to have used the international break to meet with club officials and also close friends to finally make up his mind about his future. 
And the decision is he wants to stay for two more years, and now he is waiting for the board to ratify his new £8million-a-year contract before putting pen to paper. Most read in football YOU WHAT? Alexis Sanchez casts doubts over Arsenal future after saying he wants to stay in London and play for winning team Yes way Jose Jose Mourinho is eyeing up a potential move for Atletico Madrid centre-back Jose Gimenez 'He is absurd' Jose Mourinho compares Manchester United's attempts to buy Neymar as like trying to crack open a vault Handy Andy Gladbach confirm Andreas Christensen WILL return to Chelsea after ace impressed Antonio Conte CUT AND DRIES Manchester United to offer £30m Dries Mertens £4.3m salary in bid to poach him from Napoli Arsene Wenger protest goes ahead as two banners fly over the Hawthorns 
Wenger is due to give a press conference on Thursday morning ahead of this weekend's crucial clash with Manchester City - and his future is likely to be top of the agenda. 
But it may be too early for him to make any formal announcement, with the club preferring to get the City match out of the way first before finalising terms. Getty Images
